ChannelChangeText: Channel sets the used radio frequency. It may be changed to avoid conflicts with existing wifi networks. All devices must be relearned when changing!
Device map info:
Click a device to see more details. Every device can have only one parent. Devices may change there parents by themselves. There is no way to force a device to a specific parent. (if you see more than one parent link, it may be outdated data).
You may also move devices for better visibility.
Weak and offline links are shown red. If a device label shows red, no links where found. No problem if a device has only 'Previous Parents' links, it may just have not send new data since some time.
Do you really want to delete device: Do you really want to delete device
ExtPanIDText: Extended PAN ID is the main network id, comparable to SSID of wifi networks. This id must never change for existing networks, else you have to reset and repair your devices. If you use multiple Zigbee adapter, you must make sure that they use unique ExtPanID's. Just enter 16 random hex character (a-f and 0-9).
Name: Name
PanIDText: Pan ID is some simplified id (is used by Zigbee instead of ExtPanID wherever possible). This should be unique too. Note: Zigbee network may choose a different Pan ID than you specified here in case it detects id conflicts.
Reset Info: A Soft-reset will just restart routines and CC253x. Hard-Reset will clear paired devices data and it resets CC253x settings too. You will have to repair ALL of your devices!
Select your settings. Then click RUN to: Select your settings. Then click RUN to send command to your Zigbee device.
This page is needed only for advanced us: This page is needed only for advanced users that like to extend adapter functionalities!
Transport Kex Text: Transport Key is the network encryption key. Please choose a random key sequence before you pair your devices. Just enter 32 random hex character (a-f and 0-9). If you change the key later, you will have to repair your devices.
Unbind remote from Coorinator (necessary: Unbind remote from Coorinator (necessary for some remotes like HUE Dimmer Switch)
